content:
798 
 
 
    (xxii) NDA requires two (2) other Arts and Social Science subjects 
from Economics, Government, Civic Education, Chemistry and 
Geography.  
   
UTME SUBJECTS  
(i) UYO, RENAISSANCE, OAU and EKSU require Biology.  
(ii) OAU requires any three (3) from Mathematics, Economics, 
Government, Geography, Physics, Chemistry and Biology.  
(iii) IBADAN - any three (3) subjects.  
(iv) ESUTECH requires Biology or Agricultural Science and any two 
(2) other Social Science or Arts subjects.  
(v) LAGOS requires any three (3) subjects from Mathematics,  
Biology, Physics, Chemistry, Economics, Government &  
Literature in English.  
(vi) EBSU – Economics is not compulsory.  
(vii) LASU accepts Science subjects.   
(viii) DELSU requires Mathematics and Biology.  
(ix) FED-OYE EKITI requires any three (3) subjects from  the 
Sciences or Social Sciences.  
(x) UNN requires Biology and any other two (2) subjects.  
(xi) CHRISTOPHER requires Geography and any two (2) of 
Government, Literature in English or Economics.  
RELIGIOUS STUDIES:  
UNN  
    
Two (2) 'A' level 
subjects to include 
Religious Studies  
(Christian Religious 
Studies/Islamic 
Studies).  
  
Five (5) SSC credit passes 
to include English 
Language and Christian  
Religious Studies/Islamic  
Studies  
  
Christian Religious  
Studies/Islamic 
Studies and any 
two (2) other 
subjects.  
  
DIRECT ENTRY AND UTME  
(i)  UNN in addition to the UTME requirements requires  
a. 'A' level passes in two (2) subjects including Christian Religious 
Knowledge.   
b. Holders of the ND.
